ygData.subject: Re: Freeport
ygData.msgSnippet: I used to have one of those sheilds. the weight was too much for the ac. Eglath/Xegony ... -- By G Quon, I cannot remember the last time I was in a fight like
ygData.messageBody:
I used to have one of those sheilds. the weight was too much for the ac.

Eglath/Xegony

On Tue, 11 May 1999, Thang Tran wrote:

> From: "Thang Tran" <tdt7@...>
>
> Hi
> I live in Felwithe so I cant answer your quetion, but maybe you can answer
> mine. What red shield and where in Felwithe did you buy it? Thanks
>
> Elthain of Felwithe
> Paladin of Tunare
> Mithaniel Marr
>
> >From: "King, Darrin" <dking@...>
> >Reply-To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
> >To: "'eqpaladin@onelist.com'" <eqpaladin@onelist.com>
> >Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] Freeport
> >Date: Tue, 11 May 1999 09:48:44 -0400
> >
> >From: "King, Darrin" <dking@...>
> >
> >Hail all.
> >
> >I have been around since P3 but I haven't really made many characters
> >originating in Freeport, as Tunare often beckoned me to be a High Elf.
> >
> >My new half-elf paladin last night could not for the life of him find a bag
> >or box merchant in the town anywhere. I mean the one that sells purses and
> >belt pouches, not the backpack at a guild vendor or the large bag at the
> >docks. Anyone know if the bag/box merchant exists in FP?
> >
> >Also, I know that in Felwithe there are red wooden shields which are very
> >striking and different looking than the normal round or targ ones. Has
> >anyone seen these for sale in Freeport either?
> >
> >

--
"By G'Quon, I cannot remember the last time I was in a fight like that! No
moral ambiguity. No ancient and overpowering Enemy. They were, as you say,
the Bad Guys, and we were the Good Guys....and they made a very satisfying
*thump* when they hit the ground!"
--G'Kar, A Late Delivery from Avalon
